page.title: 01GIFFORD AND SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: Gifford, a picturesque village, population 800, lies in the foothills of the Lammermuir hills. Many of the inhabitants are retired people and younger residents tend to commute daily to work in Edinburgh. The only sizeable local industry is Maslowski, drainage contractor. There are the usual organisations common to most villages including a thriving Horticultural Society. Unique to Gifford are "the Feuars" - registered as a charitable trust to administer the revenue from the "village common" for the good of the village - generally in the form of grants to the local organisations.
